about_the_game:
Star Paws is a space simulator with sandbox elements. In this simulator, you play as an astronaut cat. Your goal is to develop your own space program. Don't let having paws stop you! Build a spacecraft from a variety of components and venture into space in search for a strange signal coming from a distant deep corner of the Solar System!

Key features:

  • Combine numerous spare parts to design unique spacecrafts. Each part has its special traits that influence your spacecraft's behavior.

  • Perform complex maneuvers with full control of your spacecraft

  • Become a part of astronaut cat crew: play as one and talk to others! Complete their tasks to learn more about cat world!

  • Perform missions in space as close by scale to the real one as you can get! Visit planets of the Solar System with unique biomes. Explore their surface for minerals, caсhes and easter eggs!

  • Construct your own space stations for space observation.

  • Colonize planets.

  • Go on missions with your friends together in Online mode.

  • Develop new technologies with resources from all over the Solar System to eventually venture far beyond its limits!

name: Star Paws

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-2100 | AMD FX-6300
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 (2 GB) | AMD Radeon HD 7850 (2 GB)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-2500K | AMD FX-8350
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 (2 GB) | AMD Radeon RX 480
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible

short_description: Star Paws is a space simulator with sandbox elements. In this game, you play as an astronaut cat. Your goal is to develop your own space program. Build a spacecraft from a variety of components and venture in search for a strange signal coming from a distant deep corner of the Solar System!
